name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel New York City - Times Square

reviews.text: From the moment our concierge met us at the door, we couldn't have dreamed of a better hotel experience. I have personally traveled to several countries and have had numerous wonderful, as well as a few very poor, accomodations. The lobby was neatly appointed and spacious as was the lounge and business area. Every member of the staff was personable, helpful, and appeared to very much enjoy their job. The "cowboy" that greeted us and checked us in immediately provided me with the most up to date broadway shows available. Several staff members were a frequent source of knowledge that made our stay so much better. Our quarters, a corner suite, were exquisite. Extremely clean, spacious and comfortable. The elevators were clean, quiet, and super fast. We stepped out right onto the center of Times Square. We were literally only a few moments from everything. The Greyline Bus tours are wonderful if you want to sightsee. I was amazed at the affordability of the DoubleTree, considering the cost of rooms at the Ritz, the Plaza, Waldorf-Astoria, etc., we were extremely surprised. Thanks a million, DoubleTree Staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: I really don't need to repeat anything that everyone else has said here. It's the perfect hotel if you are a first time visitor to NYC. The price may be a little higher than what you're used to but it's because it's Times Square.
reviews.title: Like this place needs any more praise than it already has...
great customer service
reviews.text: I honestly can't say anything about this place that hasn't been said about it already. The bed was amazing and felt really good after a long day of walking, eating and drinking.
I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and have never been disappointed. Jennie Diaz at the front desk always seems to remember me and is so pleasant.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, Perfect Choice

reviews.text: The location is good and the rooms are VERY large.
reviews.title: Doubletree Time Square = Double Fun!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Classy NY style on very floor. I am a diamond member and wished they had a lounge for gold and diamond members. Breakfast is super, the bar on the lobby floor is a nice touch.
reviews.title: LOVED this property

reviews.text: Staff was very nice and let me have an early check in!
reviews.title: "Everthing we expected"

reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree in early October with our kids 5 & 9 at the time, this would have to be one of the best locations in the heart of times square . We picked this hotel based on location and the reviews from others on trip advisor and we are glad we stayed here. The staff at the entrance lobby were very friendly and welcoming as were the staff at reception and restaurant . Our room was comfortable and clean we stayed in a suite on 42nd floor and had fantastic views. We did have trouble with our wifi connection at first in our room but once we advised reception staff they were more than accomodating and gave us cable connection which worked well.Our family enjoyed New York immensely and loved our stay at Doubletree. We will definately be staying here on our next visit to New York.
reviews.title: Location couldn't be better

reviews.text: We splashed out on a Times Square View room at this hotel for our one night in New York. The room was fantastic! We had amazing views and there was plenty of space for 2 friends travelling together. We used the sofa bed, and despite requesting it in our booking we had to ask for it to be made up. Now I know sofa beds are rarely comfortable but this one was particularly bad. We each had a bathroom which was great.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!!

reviews.text: For the price of this hotel I would have hoped for slightly better amenities than we'd had in the other hotels on our trip to the USA. There were still just 2 coffee filter bags, 2 teabags, and paper cups. There was no way to heat water for tea except to use the coffee machine. We'd tried this at a previous hotel and it was awful so I rang for a pot of boiling water. I felt like I was being a nuisance after being told we could heat water in the coffee machine and saying I'd rather not do that. At this price there should be no quibbling over a pot of water for tea!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and right in the middle of Times Square

reviews.text: Slap bang in Times Square, this could not have been more convenient for everywhere we wanted to go - plus the 24-hour cabaret/sitcom/drama that is New York was right on our doorstep. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful (except for the hall porter when we left our bags with him on the last day after check-out, as we weren't flying until 11 that night. He was the most ill-tempered and unpleasant person we met on our whole stay.) We were a group of four (two parents and two grown-up daughters). Parents slept in the bedroom with its large and comfortable double bed; the girls on the pull-out double in the sitting room, which was fine. Clean and well-equipped bathroom; a proper coffee-making machine (not just a kettle and a jar of Nescafe); amazing views. Not cheap but we couldn't have asked for a better location. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: At the Big Apple's core

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very nice....but I was disappointed that at these prices I had to pay to get internet. So often included at many other hotels yet not able to access the internet from your room without incurring an additional charge. Really?? at over $400 per night I still had to pay $12.95 per day for internet. Also,have to say a great location right on Times Square. People there were very nice and attentive to any needs you may have.
reviews.title: Very nice .... but

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights. The hotel was situated in an ideal spot as there was lots to do nearby. It was very quiet inside though. The rooms were fine and everything was very clean. I would return here.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A perfect location in Times Square. This hotel is in the heart of Midtown. Easy walk to theaters, restaurants and shopping. Large, clean suites with very comfortable bedding. We opted for a Times Square view. A great view indeed. Higher floors will be a bit quiter from the hustle and bustle of Times Square below. Front desk staff was very polite and professional.
reviews.title: In the heart of Midtown

reviews.text: I'am very picky when it comes to my hotel room. I want it to be perfect. I take lysol wipes to wipe doorknobs, remotes etc. Doubletree met my expectations and more. The room was very spacious and very clean as well as looking brand new. At night I wore the same white socks for 4 nights and they still looked white by the last night, that says something for our hotel being right smack in times square.
reviews.title: It was perfect!

reviews.text: I contacted the hotel directly because we needed to have connecting rooms and I could not do that on the internet and be sure it would happen. This was a super hotel. The security was great and the location was terrific (I was hesistant because of possible noise but we were on a top floor so there was no noise). Having a small kitchen area with TWO packets of coffee made the morning better. The beds / pillows were so comfortable. We had five in this suite and there was more than ample room. We had to call for directions for pull out sofa.
reviews.title: great place - cookies good too!

likes.liked: — beds, ample room, kitchen area, warm cookies upon arrival security
likes.disliked: — upper floors might be less noisy.

reviews.title: Superb experience @ The Doubletree!!
reviews.text: We had a great experience in NYC by staying at this hotel. It was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. It was also nice to see that they had "tight security" at the front entrance. Having the suite made everything so much more convenient for a family of four. I never felt crowded and enjoyed having separate sleeping quarters/Televisions. The rooms also had a refrigerator and a microwave. (The cost of items in the stocked bar/snack machine in the room were outrageous!) The bedding was extremely comfortable! The best part was the location. We could walk anywhere, and it was so exciting to be right in the heart of Times Square during the evening hours. Our teenagers loved it. The subway was very convenient; we used it to attend a NY Yankees game, Little Italy, and China Town. We also took a great guided tour that lasted 5 1/2 hours long. We were able to get off with our tour guide at so many places--very informative yet still fun. (I can't remember the name of the Tour Bus--Party something) I would definitely go back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree Times Square 8/12 - 8/16/06 on a Hilton Honors reward certificate. The staff on the ground level entrance/security checkpoint and at the front desk on the third floor were pleasant and helpful. We were checked in and in our room within minutes.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The suite itself is very good sized by NYC standards. The living room area included an arm chair, pull out couch, desk, tv on a storage credenza, a wetbar/storage counter area that housed a sink, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, and a safe. The bedroom had an armoire for the tv and clothing storage, two end tables, a blanket chest, and the bed (which was very comfortable with great pillows and linens). The bath had about six feet of counter space, a hair dryer, full tub, and was stocked with bath amenities and plenty of good sized, soft towels daily. Housekeeping did a great job, keeping the room tidy & providing turn down service each night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Slean, Safe. Central location

likes.liked: — Location in Times Square, clean rooms

reviews.title: This is The ultimate!
reviews.text: As Hilton Honors Gold members, our room included internet service, which was was reliable and speedy, and free breakfast buffet at the hotel cafe, which we tried once & thought was good (typical hot & cold breakfast items with an omelet station and juice/coffee service).

My husband, adult daughter and I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square for the one night we were in NYC the end of September. Entrance to hotel not the nicest, but once you were upstairs to the main check in, it was fine. Hotel is right on Times Square so is in an extremely busy area but convenient for getting anywhere.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: Guest suite was good for the three of us, very clean and comfortable, no complaints. We were on a high floor facing Times Square and we found the room very quiet.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.text: Had breakfast in their restaurant and it was good.
reviews.title: Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we wanted to stay in the Times Square area in the future, we'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!!!

reviews.text: Came to NYC for 2 days and 1 night for a quick family get awy and this place worked great for the location. Even though the price was high the location makes up for it. The only problem was I made a special request for my room and it was not taken care of. I was told at check-in the things requested would be in my room. They were not there. I called and they still did not bring the items. I left for the evening and returned late and the items were still not there. I went to the desk and asked for my items and got a few things but not all that I requested. For that reason I am giving them a terrible for service and very good overall. For a Hilton this is unacceptable. When I checked out I spoke with the person that check me in and she said she was sorry for the problem I had.
reviews.title: Wonderful location
Great Hotel Made Even Better By Daniel!!
reviews.text: We had put off going to NY all these years because we heard the people in NY were rude and unfriendly - but we took a chance for 5 days on our way to Europe. Well, we decided to stay at the Doubletree Guest Suites based on their wonderful reviews - and hoped for the best. The very first person we encountered in NY - after our taxi driver - was Daniel at the front desk. He was charming, funny, welcoming, and we truly appreciated his AMAZING room upgrade to make my 50th birthday celebration even more wonderful. We are Hilton Gold VIP members - and are supposed to get a room upgrade when one is available - but often the "true" upgrades are saved for the "diamond" VIP members - and we are left to feel less like "gold" and more like "tarnished brass." But Daniel set the tone for our entire trip. He made us feel like VALUED family members - and the hotel itself is clean, spacious, and a welcome respite from the noisy world of Times Square just outside their door. Do take advantage of the fantastic proximity to all of the world-class Broadway shows within walking distance from the hotel. And by the way, we LOVED all the New Yorkers we came in contact with - so - don't delay! It was a most enjoyable trip!

If you want to stay in Times Square or Midtown area, I highly recommend this hotel. You get a full suite, with a completely separate living room -- not the traditional "NY suite", which is a slight larger room with a two foot mini-wall dividing the "bedroom" from the "living room". Most people would be scared of the noise being right in Times Square, but I usually seem to get a high floor, and rare hear much street noise, if any at all.
reviews.title: I love this place
An okay room
reviews.text: The price and lack of amenities make this room hard for me to recommend highly. It is a nice room. It is clean and has a decent amount of room to move about. The sofabed is okay but not that great. The hotel gives out free cookies after lunch. It has wifi but not in the room. If you want it in the room it is 12.00 a day. They don't have a complimentary breakfast but Mcdonalds is two stores down. Around the corner is a little shop that does wonderful breakfast sandwiches fresh. It isn't crowded or expensive. (when coming out of the hotel make a right around the corner and go about 500 yards.) My family loved the breakfasts from there. The hotel's location is excellent and right in the middle of Times Square.

This was our first stay at a Doubletree Hotel and it exceeded our expectations. We debarked from our cruise on Monday morning at 10am, and the hotel was a mere 8 miles from the Manhattan cruise terminal. Since we were early and we didn't call for early check in we had a little wait. As soon as a room was available we were speedily checked in. Ami at the front desk was very professional and courteous. We were offered complimentary breakfast for 2 for the duration of our stay, which we did not expect, but a great bonus nonetheless. Breakfast was good with a decent selection. The pastries were delicious! The room was spacious, clean and comfortable enough for 4 people. Housekeeping did a great job and there were always enough towels. There is a separate vanity/Kitchenette with coffee/tea maker and refridgerator and microwave and wetbar. The sitting area has a pullout bed, separate flat panel TV and desk.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL-GREAT SERVICE
Good location for first trip to NYC .. big rooms ... service could have been better
reviews.text: We did a city tour through Grayline Tours, and got our tickets in the hotel. The downtown tour buses pickup are very near the hotel, the uptown buses are about 1 block away (not too far). As for restuarants we ate at the Olive Garden which is in Times Square just opposite the hotel. This was the fastest sit down service we ever got!! The street vendors also sell good food at good prices and portions are large enough for two. One particular vendor sold Lebanese food on 42nd and 7th street, south of Broadway. Since it can rain at any time, its a good idea to have a poncho or umbrella handy. We did a lot of walking so comfortable shoes and a bottle of water were a must. Even if there are no kids in your party go and see the Toys R Us store.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first sight, as you get out of your Taxi in crazy Times Square, you can be underwhelmed by Doubletrees, but hang on in there. Lovely friendly security staff in the entrance lobby, puts nervous travellers (me) minds at rest. Helpful staff, but most of all lovely spacious rooms. Location is great, literately right in the middle of things.
reviews.title: Oasis in Times Square

reviews.text: Stayed at the Doubletree on Sept 11 weekend 2011. The hotel was right infront of Times Square AND the Broadway ticket booth. It's central and you can walk to all the major sites and shops on 5th avenue easily. I also hired a bicycle on my day off and cycled to the west coast of manhattan and all the way down and around to the Brooklyn bridge. EASY and felt safe at all times.
reviews.title: Right in the Thick of It

reviews.text: Got a suite, lovely views of times square from room, had complimentary internet access, felt safe all the time. Rooms were clean and quiet... good working space for a business traveller. Lovely friendly staff and the travel desk was able to book me into some awesome restaurants at the last minute.
reviews.title: would repeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would go back again because of the Location.... thought it was worth EVERY cent!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took our 3 sons ( ages 10, 14, 16) to NYC over fall break. Times Square can be overwhelming and over stimulating but this hotel was a great place to regroup and recoinoiter. We had a roomy suite. It was very functional and comfortable. Great location (duh, it's Time Square!) The only reason I did not give it an Excellent was the charge for wireless. We loved the gyro stand out front.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: My Mama went back to our room before we went on the Hop On Hop Off. She heard the door open and thought it was one of us. She called out and heard a shuffling noise and the door close. It wasn't housekeeping and she's positive because they were still across the room when she went out. When we came back that night, I noticed my Ipod Touch was GONE. I thought my Mama got it to keep but when I asked her, she said she didn't touch it. My Papa reported it to Security. Up to now, my Mama has been complaining and they keep insisting that no one entered after her. We were having a great time since I was with my parents and best friend on vacation until this happened. The General Managers never e-mailed my Mama back. I thought hotels were safe and responsible. They just kept passing my Mama to different people. New York must be so magical that my Ipod Touch decided to go out of or room and never came back while Mama was there. Take responsibility!!!
reviews.title: NOT SAFE AND MY IPOD TOUCH GOT STOLEN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because we wanted the extra space. The room was very clean and the staff efficient but not as friendly as I am used to at other Hilton properties. Will most likely try the Hampton Inn or Hilton next time we are in NY.
reviews.title: Nice NY Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed with a family of 5 (2 adults, children 7, 11 en 12) and enjoyed our stay of 5 days very much. The location right on Times Square was a great way to experience the vibe of the big city. We didn't have noise problems, although our suite was next to the elevator. From our window we looked right on the big billboards on Times Square, that was a wonderful experience! The suite wasn't really big, and with the sofa pulled out there wasn't much room in the living room, but it was adequate. Service was good and fast. We would definitely recommended the hotel to other families visiting New York.
reviews.title: enjoyed our stay a lot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over a weekend in December using HHonors points. December weekends in NYC are always busy and if you do not like to step into the crowds of Times Square as soon as you leave the lobby of the hotel this is not the place for you. Staff was nice and suite was very convenient as one of us likes to sleep in and the other does not. This may be the best hotel in midtown for families due to the room sizes! Hotel is convenient to many subway lines, restaurants (albeit more expensive ones) and broadway theatres. I recommend dining outside of Times Square as the prices are better. Had an extremely difficult time getting a cab. The doorman was of no help as there were no empty cabs so we walked several blocks until we could get one.
reviews.title: Zooish Area but Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel works perfectly when visiting NYC to see the sights and attend shows - it is convenient to everything, plus you have lots of room to stretch out (which isn't typical in NYC hotels).. Your room has a refrigerator and microwave so pack paper plates/flatware so you can heat up your leftover John's pizza or enjoy cereal in the morning before starting out. We scheduled the Onboard Tours 5 1/2 city hour tour which picked us up just a couple of blocks away. The room was clean and the staff was helpful. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for touring New York City..

reviews.text: This was our second stay and the Doubletree lived up to our memories. The hotel excels in its location and security.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel

reviews.text: Our family of 5 (three teenagers) fit neatly into the suite. Furnishings are the standard hotel industry quality - serviceable.
reviews.title: Everything we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very helpful - from the concierge and front desk to the excellent bartender who makes one of the great CC Manhattans. Housekeeping was good at bringing up the extra towels required by the four ladies in the family.
reviews.title: Great location
Excellent Location
reviews.text: Great location. My husband and our two kids 19, 22. Room was big enough. Vanity in living room gave the girls a place to do hair and makeup while the guys used the bathroom and bedroom. Two TVs bad reception most of the time. Pay movies worked fine. Clean, somewhat updated. Great beds. Bell service and conciere were absolutely awesome. Conciere knew their stuff and went above and beyond everyday. All of them. I even called them before we came to make car arrangement and Marko remembered me by name.
Shop till you drop package saved us $10 a night and gave us $50 per day gift card at bloomingdales.
reviews.title: Great Room - Skip the Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with most TA reviewers concur, the extremely affordable Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square was a pleasant and welcome stay for part of our honeymoon. WE booked far enough in advance to get below $ 300 and received a room on a high floor that was clean and about average size for a midtown Manhattan hotel. Separate sleeping quarters with a very comfortable bed (that was welcome from all the walking) makes the Doubletree a BEST DEAL considering more upscale hotels in the area charging twice our rate.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.text: Located in the middle of Times Square, across from the TKTS bleachers. Ground floor features a very nice-sized welcome area with a guard who checks room keys before you proceed to 3rd floor. 3rd floor fatures check-in, bar with tvs, etc. We NEVER had to wait for an elevator. Three elevators lead from ground to 3rd floor, then upper floors accessible by at least 5 elevators. We had 28th floor with a nice view of times square. We walked to Emipre State Bldg/Macy's, to Lion King (across the street - HELLO!), subways are VERY convenient (went to WTC and Yankees Stadium), walked to FAO, 5th ave, Rockefeller Center, to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Daisy May's BBQ, etc.
reviews.title: Perfect Central Location!

reviews.text: The room itself is a bit cramped for 6 people, as the fold-out sofa takes up a large chunk of the living room area when opened up. Service personnel VERY friendly and helpful! Room seemed either too hot or too cold - hard to find the balance at times. Free wi-fi was adequate.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Very QUIET! Never heard the sounds of the city unless you opened the windows. We would stay here again in a heartbeat! McD's next door and easy access to stores, eateries, you name it.
reviews.title: recommend, recommend, recommend!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took 3 teenageers to the city for an overnight. We booked the Doulbletree on hotwire for 199/night. We were very happy with the large room (1 bedroom suite) which had a queen size bed in the bedroom and a queen size sofabed in the living room. The bathroom was huge. We had a great view of Times Square. All-in-all it was perfect.
reviews.title: Not a great experience

reviews.text: Location is indeed fantastic, in the heart of Time Square ! We were a bit scared to have some noises in the room, but we've been pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it to the max !

reviews.text: The suites are quite big for NYC, the furniture could be "updated" as it is a bit old fashion, but very confy anyways.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We've enjoyed our stay in NYC, the hotel staff was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!!

reviews.text: Nothing negative to add, except maybe the prices, but hey.. it is worth it !!!! :)
reviews.title: a great base in the heart of new york

reviews.text: My wife and I travelled with our 2 chidlren aged 18 & 13
reviews.title: It may have just been the day.

reviews.text: The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was always clean, the housekeeping staff was very friendly. The location is very convinient as there is a subway station right next to it. Also, it is in the middle of all the action! Will stay there next time I visit NYC.
reviews.title: Excellent view of Times Square

reviews.text: For our first visit to NY, we chose Doubletree Guest Suites right on Times Square, putting us in the middle of the action. We were steps away from the subway (bought the MTA $29 7 day unlimited passes), close to theaters (saw Spiderman show!), and restaurants (sampled lots of NY food items unique to the area). What I noticed about this Hilton property was the room layout contained a mini-fridge, microwave, 2 large modern flatscreen TVs, and separate bedroom, making it stand out among other hotels in the area. We were able to use a Britta water filtration unit and a special blow up airbed to make the trip even more comfortable with our family of 4.
reviews.title: Best Location, great room layout, view from 26th floor, great employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to commend 2 people at the front desk that really exhibited professionalism and care, making hotel operations easy. Manny at the front desk was very helpful when we checked in. He even responded to our request for a room with a Times Square view, noticing we made it when we made the original reservations, but it was inadvertently left off our move in paperwork. We were able to move into a great room on the 26th floor with a killer view of Times Square the next night. Make sure you also chose a higher floor as we did, because Time Square can be really noisy if you stay on the lower levels of any hotel in the area! Ami, also at the front desk, was very professional and nice, offering to let us have late checkout at the end of our trip so we didn't have to wander around like nomads with our luggage bound for JFK. I talked to her a few other times with requests, and she was always very willing to help - the mark of a quality establishment.
reviews.title: We loved it here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people operating the front desk at this hotel care about their guests, in our two experiences with Manny and Ami. I was also very pleased to find most New Yorker's a very friendly bunch everywhere we encountered them. I brought my Southern California impressions of NY and left with great impressions of the people and rich culture of NY.
reviews.title: Great location, couldn't have asked for more!
Great place to stay
reviews.text: The maids cleaning the rooms also listen to requests and try their best to do this quickly and efficiently. I am used to staying in rented timeshares, and the Doubletree Hilton here is the closest thing you get to that so close to Times Square.

reviews.title: Great Base of Operations
reviews.text: My 6 yo son and I went to a wedding in NY and I wanted to show him "The Sites". We spent 1 night at the Doubletree Guests Suites in Time Square.

reviews.title: Perfect location if you need to stay in the heart of Times Square.
reviews.text: Okay.the hotel is in a great location, but it took a while to find since it is not on Broadway but 8th? Hard see through the action!

reviews.title: Location is Brilliant
reviews.text: The lobby is strange. Think 1978 disco-hip meets post-recession-ism. Weird, cold and certainly not warm or welcoming. The staff was efficient and friendly enough.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Great Place
reviews.text: The rooms are great though. Large for the area, and a suite too!

reviews.title: Fantatsic location, right in the heart of Times square
reviews.text: The sofa is not very comfy to sit on for a movie so watch them from the beds. The beds are heavenly!!! I slept like a log at both Double trees (see Mahwah, NJ post).

Excellent hotel, suite rooms, fantastic location, plus hot cookies! Lots of rooms look out on Time Square, but some do look out on brick wall. Rooms that end in 01, 02 are behind elevator and can be noisy. 03 rooms are nice corner rooms that look out on Time Square. Staff all pleasant and helpful. Refridge, microwave and pod style coffee maker in each room, plus honor bar. Rooms have seperate living room and bedroom which are roomy with nice televisions, and a nice bathroom. Concierge helpful and knowledgeable with local restaurants.
reviews.title: Double Tree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from a long weekend trip to NYC and stayed at this property for 2 nights. It is right in the middle of Times Square, convieniently located to everything you desire. We were on the 24th floor facing 7th Ave, so it would get a bit noisy. We requested a great view so we were prepared to live with the sirens and noise for the great view. The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom, while a little on the small size was fine for the two of us. I would definetly stay here again on our next trip to NYC.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Time Square for 8 nights in early March 2012 and we were very pleased with the hotel and staff. The room was very spacious, with a nice living room and seperate bedroom. Each room had a large TV with a variety of different channels. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed our warn cookies apon arrival. We would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again next time we visit New York
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: We stayted at the Doubletree Guest Suites Time Square during our April 2012 school vacation week, a busy time for the hotel and NYC. We stayed for 5 days/4 nights in 2 rooms ("suites") for 5 people (2 parents, 3 kids ages 6,4, and 2).
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff, suite set-up is great

reviews.text: We had a fairly positive experience with this hotel and would recommend it to those with families and young kids. For a family of 4 (2 parents, 2 kids) you can make due with 1 suite (1 bedroom + living room with pull-out) and get a great value for a phenomenal location.
reviews.title: Excellent loction on Times Square
The best hotel in Newyork
reviews.text: Tito at the front desk was very nice, like the rest of them, the door men everyone, just all very nice. clean and big rooms, great adress ect. ect.

reviews.title: Stayed 7+ times, Only hotel I'll use in NY
reviews.text: I´ll be back!!!

reviews.title: SAFE AND CLEAN AND FANTASTIC !!!
reviews.text: I regularly take groups of 5 to 15 students to New York and this is the only hotel we use. You can't beat the location--walk out the front door and you're in Times Square, though remarkably when you are in your room, there is no street noise. Perfectly quiet. Subway line is right there too. Easy walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center is right around the corner... Security is excellent as the lobby is on the 3rd floor and you have to show your key before they'll let you up there. It keeps stragglers out. I've stayed in the conference suites and regular suites, all are excellent. Some conference suites have 2 bathrooms which is great. Very comfortable and clean with a refrigerator and a safe. Climate control keeps the room at just the right temperature. Excellent maid service who always get our room cleaned by the time we get back, but are never obtrusive. Friendly staff who handle requests quickly. They take care of diamond members. Breakfast buffet is good, free internet in the lobby, very large rooms which are hard to come by in NY, flat screen televisions, large bathrooms, good views of the city, extremely fast elevators. Takes only seconds to get from floor 3 to 41. Our flight was delayed and we needed extended checkout, hotel took care of it without any problem. I've had faxes sent to the hotel for me, front desk gets them to me immediately. The staff are friendly, professional, and extremely efficient. Even after 7 stays, I know the hotel inside and out, and can't really think of any negatives. The ONLY thing I would suggest is that they inventory a few of the conference suites with 2 beds instead of just the single king as that is such a large space that could be used to sleep one or two more people comfortably. We'll be back soon.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: We stayed with our twin boys that are 4 years old. The hotel staff were great. Michael at the front desk always has a smile. WE always felt safe with the staff there and by the key checks. The only thing I would like to see changed would be an upright bike in the exercise room. The rooms were very big and had the best value in Times Square. I forgot my side of the bed was way to soft.They need to ccheck all the beds in the future to see if they need to be replaced.

reviews.title: Amazing location and phenomenal value
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of visiting New York during the week of April 5, 2010. I had my 16 year son with me. We had a King Size room which he slept on the pull out couch and I had the bedroom. I love the rooms and the fact there are 2 TV's which made my life alot easier as i could watch the daily happenings in the Big Apple on the news and he could watch what he wanted. The rooms were clean and large. The bathroom was great. We were on the 37th Floor and the elevators were fast getting there. The housecleaning staff were exceptional and friendly. I would have liked to have upgraded to a double room so my son didn't have to sleep on the pullout. I really do not have any complaints at all except the phone in the bedroom didn't work and the fridge seemed to not keep things cold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, Great hotel. Mentioned to Daniel at check in that my wife and I were celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary and got upgraded to a 40th floor panoramic times square view suite! Living room, dining room, master bedroom, 2 bathrooms. Awesome! Really made our Anniversary special! Thanks to Daniel and the rest of the staff! We will be back!
reviews.title: Check in with Daniel!

reviews.text: I am a member of the Hilton Honors Program and often use points to say here. I request a high floor because it is more fun. Took my girls to see Broadway shows and eat for weekend for lots of years. Recently I stayed there for two nights while visiting friends in the city. Cookie on check-in, medium firm beds, fluffy pillows and in the heart of Broadway. Very safe for kids as you must show your key to get upstairs. Convenient to walk to TKTS to buy show tickets, and return to rest until you venture out for dinner and the show. Across from Olive Garden, Roxy, and only a few blocks for Carmine's, Virgils, and Sarde's. One of the good ones!
reviews.title: One of my favorites!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have traveled throughout the U.S., Europe and South America and I have never come across someone like "Sheriff Daniel." He is a genuine and truly cares about his guests. Keep up the good work Sheriff! I have recommended the Doubletree Guest Suites to many colleagues and friends due to the fine and unique service I received from Sheriff Daniel. Thank you for making a lasting impression.
reviews.title: Genuine Hospitality

reviews.text: I have to stay in Times Square for business which itself is a tough break. Rooms are exceptional (always two rooms) for the area, but I was disappointed by the fitness center compard to nearby Mariott. But I guess fitness might not be a priority for the location. For business (and therefore you're not paying) go to the Marriott.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, pricey, but whatdya expect in Times Square
First try at DT Suites TS
reviews.text: A few things, this hotel gets a 6 stars for location! Cannot be much better than this, now the down side to this. The streets are packed with tourists, if there is a concert going on it would be impossible to have a car pick you up close to the hotel.

reviews.title: WHAT FREE COOKIES?
reviews.text: When we booked this hotel nearly 12 months ago, we chose to upgrade the room and decided on a premium suite with 2 double beds with city view. Well, we certainly got the double beds but as for the view ?!?! To say I was dissapointed by what view we got is an understatement. To think that we paid extra to look at next doors roof top and their generators is certainly not what I was expecting!!

reviews.title: Perfect location!
reviews.text: Also after reading numerous reviews on here I was waiting for our free warm choc chip cookies upon check in - but to no avail. I know this is trivial, but when a company makes such an advertisement then you expect them to deliver every time. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but that was no real big problem, after all we were a little early. Our bags were placed in storage for a couple of hours while we went and explored the area. Upon check out, we again used the storage as we only had an evening flight home and I have to say, was very suprised not to be charged for this service as, after all you get nothing for free in NY!

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel central location
reviews.text: Now, as for everything else, then I could not fault it. The staff that we encountered were friendly and always had a smile on their face. A simple request for extra coffee was granted and we were always kept well stocked up.

reviews.title: Great Location, poor service
reviews.text: The beds were comfy, even the pull out sofa bed that I used for the whole stay. We had maid service everyday (although I never actually saw one) and could not fault their service.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: If we wanted to see Times Square from the hotel, then we had to look out of the window near to the lifts. We were staying on the 18th floor. Lifts as in all of NY were quick and we never had to wait no more than a few minutes for one.
I stayed there in a higher floor with a room directly on TSQ view (only one of such in each floor)
reviews.title: Why stay in a 3 star when you can go for 5 for the same price

reviews.text: Notice I say a ROOM and not a SUITE because I don't consider a 200sq foot space a suite. It is very small and basically like a 200sqf room divided by walls into two making the space for each room very tiny. so you have only space to tightly walk around the bed in the bedroom and very tight to hardly walk and sit on a ONE very small sofa in the living room. The bathroom size OK for NYC, but overall cleanness is not satisfactory. The sheets smelled like smoke if not vomit!! I arrived at 1:00AM there and just wanted to crash and didnt wanna complain or wait for them to change the sheets.
reviews.title: No place like Times Square

reviews.text: The AC fan was broken and stayed on HIGH the whole night making the room very cold and not to mention noisy because the AC unit is inside the room (kind of like an appartment)
reviews.title: Lots of room and excellent location!

reviews.text: If you are gonna spend $300-$400 a night go around and get a nice room in W, Sheraton or Marriott...This place has nothing to do with the word "Suite"
reviews.title: Hotel in the middle of the action

reviews.text: Four of us stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square at 1568 Broadway. It was our first trip to New York, so when we pulled up to the hotel and saw what Times Square looked and sounded like, we all thought there would be very little sleep over the next week. Thankfully, we were wrong.
reviews.title: Service comes at a price

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights early May at Doubletree Times Square. We were very happy with the hotel. We checked in at the 3rd floor lobby at about 2:30 pm on a Sunday. We asked for and received an upgrade to a corner premium suite with a view of Times Square on the 32nd floor. Nice and quiet at this height.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in Times Square

reviews.text: The entrance (living) room had a large screen TV, desk and chair, sofa bed, fridge and sink. The bedroom had a king bed, dresser wrap around windows on corner, ample closet. The linens were good and the bathroom large enough. Tub drained slowly but the water pressure was fine.
reviews.title: What a great place- Except for Fee-based internet....

reviews.text: We had no problem at all with the room. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, except for one bellman at the belldesk when we left our luggage for later pickup after we had checked out.
reviews.title: Good location, good service + roomy suite
Great Hotel in Times Square
reviews.text: Although not cheap we would stay here again. We loved the location and the service was very good.

I travel to NYC each spring for work and like to try different hotels. It has become more challenging as I smoke to find a good hotel. This year I booked Doubletree and what a pleasure it was. Two room suite overlooking Times Square yet no noise to bother me when I slept on the marvelous bed. Great work area and the bathroom was devine. Absolutely no complaints except getting banged for the internet- THAT IS RIDICULOUS!@. The staff was great as well. I will be back next year. Great base of operations. Now, I will campaign them to offer free internet....
reviews.title: Great time had by all

reviews.text: The Doubetree provides excellent personal service. From checking in with Michael or Daniel to having the best breakfast in the city with Hostess Hannah McCauley, Eugene the master chef or Solomon or Mo the best servers in the world! The rooms are very spacious and nice and the location is the best in the city. I make sure my return trips to NY always include the Doubetree Times Square. They treat you like family there.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel experience

reviews.text: Three of us stayed here for five nights on a "girls' holiday".
reviews.title: Amazingly quiet, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was perfect for us since we had two rooms - one with two beds and the living area with a sleeper sofa. My sister chose the sofa bed and was comfortable, but if you are an adult with any back pain issues at all, I wouldn't try it. I would have been disabled for the entire trip if I had tried to sleep on it. It's probably fine for kids/younger people. The bathroom was large and had two doors so that we didn't have to disturb each other at night. Also, the wet bar in the living area, which was right outside the bathroom door, had a mirror and outlets, so we could take a shower and then move out there for hair and make-up. It worked great for us.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the top floor of the hotel and there was no noise at all at night. Even on the lower floors, it was quiet, which is amazing since the hotel is in such a busy area. We rarely heard any noise from people in other rooms.
reviews.title: A memorable stay

reviews.text: The service from all of the staff was excellent. We met people who really enhanced our stay, especially the desk clerk that wears a rhinestone cowboy hat and Carlos Saldana, who sells Hilton vacations. The only down side of the service was the bartender at happy hour during the week, who was pretty non-communicative and not tourist-friendly at all. On Friday a different bartender was working and he was great. We used the Concierge desk several times and received invaluable information from them. The service from the room attendants was stellar.
reviews.title: In the Heart of it All

reviews.text: We stayed July 14-18. Had a king bedroom with sofa bed in living room. Paid extra for a view of times Square which was wonderful and kept us entertained at all hours of the day and night just looking out the window. It is great with binoculars which we had brought with us.
reviews.title: Nice and Clean and Safe
stay here, but skip room service
reviews.text: Room and hotel was clean, and with the doormen we felt very safe being a group of females ranging in age from 8-44. Only minuses were the sofa bed - the cushions would not stay on the sofa when you sat down on it to watch t.v. and the t.v. in living room had interference at night so could not watch t.v. at night. Furniture in lobby is run down and you sink to the bottom when you sit on them. These things are expected when traveling and staying in hotels. I recommend this hotel for travelers to Manhattan/Times Square. Our room was $329 per night with the extra for the view. Stayed on the 11th floor.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: excellent location, friendly staff, but do yourself a large favor and skip eating at the hotel. food was unclean on three occasions (the 3 times we utilized room service).

we stayed at the double tree suites in Time square june 20-25 The location was fantastic the rooms were nice and clean the staff was very helpful the restauarant and lounge were great If you want to be in the heart of time square this is the hotel for you Internet service is free in the lobby and lounge but is pay for use in the rooms You must have a wireless connection to use the service the business
reviews.title: Just returned July 9, 2006

reviews.text: highly recommend the Double Tree-
reviews.title: Stayed 4th of July
A Solid Reliable Choice in Times Square
reviews.text: Nothing negative to mention, and a couple pluses. Good size room - can be unusual for NYC. An empty fridge (at least in our 2 room suite) for our use. We were high enough (in floor numbers) that there was almost no street noise (and I would recommend you request this). It was no Ritz but all I want, especially in the city, is clean and comfortable and a bit of room to stretch out, and this fit the bill. Some will love the Times Square location - it's close to so many attractions - and some will not, but it's a fine choice for those who do.

The Doubletree in Times Square is in awesome location. Times Square is right outside the front door of the hotel. The public areas are nice, and the rooms are clean, but nothing special. In fact, the fold-out bed in the living room area was saggy, lumpy, and uncomfortable. However, the view out the window was spectacular.
reviews.title: Great Location. Overpriced for what it is.

reviews.text: It really wasn't worth the $350 a night we paid for it except for the location.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel is right in the middle of Time Square. It is close to everything. It is only a few blocks to Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, and it is close to the subway. The rooms were large for a New York hotel room. It is a little pricey, but it is a good deal for the size of the room and the location.
reviews.title: A quiet hotel room in Times Square

reviews.text: Hard to believe, but our room was very quiet even though we were in the middle of all the action in Times Square. The 2 room suite would be great anytime there are more than two guests. We had a very nice stay! I can't come up with any negatives. The Hilton Honors perks and upgrade were unexected and made this a real value. We'll be back.
reviews.title: great location
Great location
reviews.text: The main advantage to this hotel is its location right at the heart of New York’s Times Square. It really is right at the centre of all the main sights. Security is tight and we found the service at the front desk to be very efficient. The hot cookies were a treat. Our suite suited us great as we are a family of four and our two teenage boys had a room two themselves. As Hilton Gold members we had a complimentary buffet breakfast each morning at the price of $77 – a great bonus, although the service there was not always with a smile! The one complaint we made to the front desk regarding the safe was quickly sorted out by an engineer. The price for a family of four was OK. On leaving the hotel the bellman was as efficient as the rest of the staff. I would certainly recommend this hotel to a family wanting to stay in midtown New York.
I've now stayed twice at the Double Tree on Times Square when on business, for a few days each time.
reviews.title: A good spot

reviews.text: I can't really think of anything significant to fault it. Rooms are well equipped and clean. The hotel has good facilities including restaurant and bar. Security also seemed to be taken seriously. Most staff were friendly and all were professional.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: On arrival the second time I was given a slightly over done hot cookie at reception - strange, but a nice thought.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
Great location
reviews.text: The best thing of all has to be it's location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was great for our 4 night stay. Check in went smoothly and our 15th floor suIte was very nice. We had a view of 47th to the corner of Times Square. I was a bit concerned about the light and noise, but not a problem. The darkening curtains and excellent sound proofing kept " the city that never sleeps" out of sight and sound all night until we were ready for it.
reviews.title: Had a grand time at the Doubletree Times Square

reviews.text: We saved a lot of $$ by using our fridge and microwave and preparing our own breakfasts. There was a nice wheeled table to eat at while we caught the morning news.
reviews.title: Stay Somewhere Else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely choose this hotel again. It was not cheap but I liked it better than other hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The location alone will save a lot of trekking around.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the heart of Time Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is the Pits .. Dark,Tired and old .. Decor a hangiver from the seventies.Poor Service,Asked for wine glasses not provided in room took 3 phone calls finally arrived 45 minutes later. Forget room service food mine was cold and unedible.. For the money it was a rip off An average 3 star Hotel If you must stay in Times Sq go around the corner to The Casablanca ..
reviews.title: Location is everything

reviews.text: This is a brilliant hotel. It's entrance is right on the corner, so be aware that you'll step right out into the heart of Time Square. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel, opting to go out into the city every night/morning.
reviews.title: not what we expected

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in July 2011, and it was fantastic. Our King Suite was a decent size and had a totally separate living room (with good sized sofabed) and bedroom.....so great for a family of 4. Staff were excellent - always responded quickly to the (minor) issues we had......and they give you a cookie for reporting a maintenance problem! Pretty much the same price as a regular hotel. Really quiet (on the 43rd floor) despite the buzz below. Excellent breakfast buffet (go for the inclusive rate though, as it would be $17 per person or something to purchase separately. This hotel is right on Times Square, so you do have to wade through thousands of people to get to the door......but it is a great location for travel up or down town.
reviews.title: Excellent Times Square Family Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I enjoyed our five night stay in this hotel very much. The reception staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. Suite of two rooms plus bathroom was clean and well kept. Age showed in the bathroom but was perfectly well-functioning and clean. Windows opened so we could listen to Times Square noise from our room on the 16th floor long into the night. The location was brilliant- in the heart of the city, only walking distance from Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue, Central Park. In fact, we walked nearly everywhere from the hotel. Already making plans to return to New York, would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good value for money, excellent location.

reviews.text: nice,clean big room and a good staff. Great location in Times square close to the best theatres and restaurants in town.
reviews.title: nice stay at this hotel

reviews.text: A bit crazy right on the square, but centrally located. It is a nice hotel and room was comfortable.
reviews.title: Right in the middle of the action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually live in NY but stayed here for our anniversary so it needed to be good! Everyone was so welcoming from the minute we got there. Andrew checked us in quickly and offered additional information about what was going on in town that weekend and was extremely friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, right in the action but so peaceful and relaxing inside
Great Hotel. Perfect Location.
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights with girlfriends and we had no complaints. I recommend this hotel to anyone. Hotel is in the center of Times Square which made our stay even better. I definetly would stay here again. The room size was perfect. Beds very comfortable. Nice bathroom size. Thumbs up for Doubletree Times Square Suites.
Overall you are going to pay a lot for a hotel in NYC. Well in perspective this hotel might be a steal considering the prices of other hotels that look over Times Sq.
reviews.title: For Times Square I guess you cant beat the rate

reviews.text: Check-in
reviews.title: Good location and room to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were very helpful in that we had an extra room and they worked it our without charging us. (I think they were over booked so they were happy to do it.)
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable bed, but a little disappointed

reviews.text: The checkin was quick in the fact we were doing the room swap thing.
reviews.title: Excellent location with average amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights (award) and found the hotel just as good as my last stay several years ago. The place was fully booked as there was a jewelry and fashion accesories convention occupying 9 floors. As a result, did not receive any upgrade for Gold status.
reviews.title: An Oasis in Time Square Chaos

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location -- plus

reviews.text: -spacious 2-room suites with 2 TV's, microwave, small empty fridge, touch-sensored honor bar, and small safe.
reviews.title: Nice place in the heart of the theatre district

reviews.text: -free wireless HSIA for gold and diamond members (no wired access available)
reviews.title: Best Hotel in NY

reviews.text: -complimentary full hot breakfast buffet for gold and diamonds (normally $28) at restaurant
reviews.title: Great location, great view of Time Square. Very nice!

reviews.text: doubletree guest suites is one of the finest hotels in NYC. located just about 30 - 45 minutes from JFK airport, right in the heart of broadway. the entire locality is hustling and bustling with life and action. everything is like a block or 2 away from the hotel. shopping from the best brands to the best malls, restaurants of all types, broadway shows, times square .. you name it and its there. you get a panoramic view from the room as they are situated high above. the rooms are very spacious with a living room followed by the bed room. they provide in house entertainment like movies video games PS2 etc. since it is so centrally located you spend your entire day roaming NYC. i would recommend anyone staying in NYC that double tree is the place to be in. superb location, most curt staff, valet parking service, very confortable living.since the rooms are located quite high for us it was onthe 35th floor your right in the middle of action an yet away from the noise when you want to be.
reviews.title: doubletree has action all around it

reviews.text: This is my favorite hotel in the Times Square area for two reasons. The space and the centric location. It lacks a good service response, a nice accessible entrance, it is not that quiet unless you book a suite in the higher floors, and it is a little expensive, but the extra space is worth it.
reviews.title: Centric hotel

reviews.text: When we first pulled up in front on the hotel in our taxi we were a little hesitant to get out as it was a busy Saturday afternoon and wondered what we had gotten ourselves into with the mobs of people everywhere!
reviews.title: Fantastic view and wonderful room~ great hotel!!
girlfriend getaway
reviews.text: You enter into a small room with a guard at a podium who asks for your name on the check in list and sends you up to the 3rd floor. (at night you have to show your room key to the guard upon entering). When you get off on the 3rd floor there is a small bar with some snacks and a small lounge area and the check in counter. Everyone we encountered was very nice and helpful. We were told we were upgraded to a 'Conference Suite' and our Times Square view was granted.

Our room was fantastic, it was on the 37th floor and a corner suite! We had a large bath (only negative ~one sink), nice sized bedroom with the most comfortable king size bed and a great view to look at over the nice desk. We had a dining room with a large wet bar and a coffee maker, fridge, microwave oven. The view was spectacular but the living room view was to die for. Our boys shared the pull out sofa bed which they said was very comfortable and they slept with the blinds open every night to take in everything. I also have to mention the room was pretty quiet too. As I type this sitting at the dining room table looking into our living room I see the '2009 and ball' that drop's for New Year's Eve. 360 views out of every window and and not into another building. We had paid for the breakfast included pkg which we were so glad we did because there really isn't a 'decent' breakfast place around that serves a full breakfast. The breakfast is a buffet with a large variety of food items.
reviews.title: Best Times Square view you can get, comfy spacious suite

description: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton - Times Square is the only all-suite hotel located on Broadway in the heart of Times Square excitement. Located at 1568 Broadway (47th Street & 7th Avenue), the hotel recently underwent a multi-million dollar renovation and is surrounded by Broadway theaters, New York City’s world-famous restaurants, shopping, museums and sightseeing. A TKTS booth, offering discount theater tickets, is directly across from the hotel. Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, The Museum of Modern Art, Fifth Avenue shopping, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Carnegie Hall and Central Park are all within walking distance. The hotel is just 15 blocks from Jacob Javits Convention Center, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden, Port Authority Bus Terminal and convenient to Grand Central Terminal and all (3) area airports.All of the hotel’s 460 two-room suites feature living room with sofa bed plus private bedroom and bathroom, Sweet Dreams by DoubleTree Sleep Experience bedding and modern amenities including two flat-screen televisions, wet bar, refrigerator, microwave, MP3 connectivity and large work desk with ergonomic chair. Onsite hotel amenities include newly renovated lobby with new check-in area, new Concierge/Theater Ticket Desk, brand new Ad Lib lobby lounge, brand new Gingers Restaurant, morning Coffee Kiosk, room service, complimentary 24-hour Fitness Center and complimentary 24-hour business center. The hotel has 10,000 square feet of modern event space. The hotel is 100% non-smoking. Self & valet parking is available. The hotel allows pets, with a $50 pet surcharge per stay (under 60 lbs). 24-hour Security onsite.
